item
Class LightGrenade

java.lang.Object
  item.Item
      item.LightGrenade
All Implemented Interfaces:
IItem, ILightGrenade
public class LightGrenade
extends Item
implements ILightGrenade

Light grenades are items that can be picked up and used by a player. There are three states for a light grenade: ACTIVE , INACTIVE, EXPLODED. A light grenade always starts in the INACTIVE state. When the light grenade then gets used by a player the internal state of this item will be changed to ACTIVE. The light grenade can now explode whenever the explode() method is called. After exploding the light grenade converts to it's last state EXPLODED, this will convert the item to a immutable object.

Author:
Bavo Mees

static class LightGrenade.LightGrenadeState
          An enumeration of the states a LightGrenade can have and the allowed transitions between them.

enable

public void enable()
            throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
Description copied from interface: ILightGrenade
This method sets the state of the grenade to LightGrenade.LightGrenadeState .ACTIVE. It cannot be called until the player who dropped the lightgrenade and triggered it, left the square.

Specified by:
enable in interface ILightGrenade
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - The transition to the ACTIVE state must be valid from the current state: this.getState().isAllowedTransistionTo(LightGrenadeState.ACTIVE)
